cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE. 

This paper is about natural language sentence matching, which is a central topic in computational linguistics and natural language processing. The paper proposes a new deep architecture for this task, which involves using bidirectional long short term memory (Bi-LSTM) to generate multiple positional sentence representations and aggregating them to produce a matching score. This work is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), and neural networks (cs.NE).
